multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: commodities; Gold and copper assay results at Wildhorse may lift commodity prices and mining sector sentiment, potentially boosting related equity and commodity futures.

category.motivation: The article reports a company exploration update, not earnings.

impact.motivation: The article reports a localized mining exploration result with no clear macro‑market catalyst or broader commodity impact.

time_frame.motivation: The article reports a recent, specific sampling result that directly impacts the company's exploration status, an event that is immediate and short‑term in nature.

article_node.title: Latest Assay Results Show Gold Sample at 11.2 g/t + 11.35 g/t of Silver on Glenstar's Wildhorse Project and Lays the Foundation for Expanded Phase 2 Exploration Work Program
article_node.summary: Glenstar Minerals Inc. announced that 29 stream‑sediment samples from its Wildhorse property in Nevada yielded promising results, including 11.2 g/t gold and 11.35 g/t silver, along with copper, tungsten, bismuth and tellurium. The findings reinforce an intrusive‑center skarn model and highlight new prospective drainages, prompting the company to plan an expanded Phase 2 exploration program. The company will continue sampling to refine its understanding of the localized mineralization in the identified zones.
